Program Name: Registered Nurse – Operating Room Perioperative Nursing
Code: S414
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 semester
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $2,301.00 *
Centre: Health Sciences
School: Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
Location: Waterfront Campus
Delivery: Hybrid (Fall 2023), Externship (Winter 2024)
Program Description: Prepares Registered Nurses with theoretical and technical skills to work as operating room nurses. ORNAC approved and adheres to ORNAC Standards of Practice.
Program Availability: Fall 2023 (Closed), Winter 2024 (Closed), Spring 2024 (Open)
Related Programs: Practical Nursing (PN) (S121), Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.Sc.N.) (S118), Registered Nurse – Critical Care Nursing (Postgraduate) (S402)

The program is a nursing course focused on operating room principles and practice for various surgical specialties. It consists of two phases.

Phase I: Nursing 4045 (first five weeks)
- Students learn current ORNAC standards, principles and applications
- Study of surgical anatomy and instrumentation
- Intensive study of surgical interventions and technologies
- Role of the scrub nurse and circulating nurse
- Clinical lab skills delivered at George Brown's Operating Room in their accredited Simulation Centre

Phase II: Nursing 4046 (second phase, eight weeks)
- Consolidate operating room theory and principles at a hospital facility during a clinical placement
- Development of the scrub nurse role and circulating nurse role
- Exposure to various surgical specialties such as General Surgery, Urology, Gynecology, Plastic Surgery, ENT and Orthopedic Surgery
- Safe and professional practice
- Online discussions and clinical assignments through live video conferences and completion as per the course syllabus
- Clinical experiences are coordinated by the program co-ordinator at hospitals in and outside of the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) or at the student's current workplace. Sponsored students complete their clinical placements at their employing hospital.
- Students must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to complete clinical placements within facilities due to public health recommendations and agency requirements.

* George Brown College offers a postgraduate certificate program in Registered Nurse – Operating Room Perioperative Nursing.
* Students completing this program are eligible to apply for transfer credits towards Toronto Metropolitan University's Post-Diploma B.Sc.N. program.
* The required courses include NURS 4045 (Operating Room Nursing – Theory and Labs) and NURS 4046 (Operating Room Nursing – Practicum).
* Program Learning Outcomes: Students will be able to practice professionally, develop therapeutic relationships, communicate effectively, prioritize nursing care, implement interventions, use technological tools, and adhere to standards of practice.
* Domestic tuition for one semester starting in Fall 2022 is $2,301.00 (amounts subject to change for future program starts).
* RNs registered and employed in Ontario priority areas may be eligible for a Nursing Education Initiative (NEI) grant.

context:
* George Brown College offers a postgraduate certificate program in Registered Nurse – Operating Room Perioperative Nursing.
* Students completing this program are eligible to apply for transfer credits towards Toronto Metropolitan University's Post-Diploma B.Sc.N. program.
* The required courses include NURS 4045 (Operating Room Nursing – Theory and Labs) and NURS 4046 (Operating Room Nursing – Practicum).
* Program Learning Outcomes: Students will be able to practice professionally, develop therapeutic relationships, communicate effectively, prioritize nursing care, implement interventions, use technological tools, and adhere to standards of practice.
* Domestic tuition for one semester starting in Fall 2022 is $2,301.00 (amounts subject to change for future program starts).
* RNs registered and employed in Ontario priority areas may be eligible for a Nursing Education Initiative (NEI) grant.

Program Information:
- Name: Nursing Education Initiative (NEI) grant
- Eligibility: MOHLTC priority area students
- Website: rnao.ca/education-funding/nei
- OSAP funding approval

Admission Requirements:
- RN or Certificate of Competence, College of Nurses of Ontario without practice restrictions
- BCLS (Heart and Stroke Foundation), HCP Level
- Current resume
- Interview by telephone
- Recommended two years of surgical nursing experience in the hospital setting

Student Categories:
1. Independent Student:
   - Application and tuition fees
   - Not hired by a clinical agency
   - Clinical placement arranged by program coordinator
   - Complete pre-placement health form requirements and VSS upon acceptance

2. Sponsored Student:
   - Hired by the clinical agency prior to applying to the program
   - Program fees may or may not be covered based on hiring contract details
   - Clinical placement completed at the hospital student is employed

Program Restrictions:
- Open to domestic applicants only
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions (check Transfer Guide)

Pre-placement Health Requirements:
- Submit proof of a satisfactory medical examination before entering field placement
- Students unable to provide clear medical examination results will not be able to complete the program.

Important Notes:
- Information is subject to change without notice.
- Verification of George Brown College fee requirements is the students' responsibility.
- Contact nursing@georgebrown.ca for sponsorship and admission requirements information.

3. what are the admission requirements for the nursing program at George Brown College?

context:
Program Information:
- Name: Nursing Education Initiative (NEI) grant
- Eligibility: MOHLTC priority area students
- Website: rnao.ca/education-funding/nei

Admission Requirements:
- RN or Certificate of Competence, College of Nurses of Ontario without practice restrictions
- BCLS (Heart and Stroke Foundation), HCP Level
- Current resume
- Interview by telephone
- Recommended two years of surgical nursing experience in the hospital setting

Student Categories:
1. Independent Student:
   - Application and tuition fees
   - Not hired by a clinical agency
   - Clinical placement arranged by program coordinator
   - Complete pre-placement health form requirements and VSS upon acceptance

2. Sponsored Student:
   - Hired by the clinical agency prior to applying to the program
   - Program fees may or may not be covered based on hiring contract details
   - Clinical placement completed at the hospital student is employed

Program Restrictions:
- Open to domestic applicants only
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions (check Transfer Guide)

Pre-placement Health Requirements:
- Submit proof of a satisfactory medical examination before entering field placement
- Students unable to provide clear medical examination results will not be able to complete the program.

Important Notes:
- Information is subject to change without notice.
- Verification of George Brown College fee requirements is the students' responsibility.
- Contact nursing@georgebrown.ca for sponsorship and admission requirements information.

Students in the nursing program at George Brown College are required to have a Police Vulnerable Sector Check completed and renewed annually before entering into field or clinical placements. The process typically takes 2-3 months but can take up to 8 months. Students are responsible for ensuring their check covers appropriateness for individuals working with vulnerable persons. Students who cannot provide a clear check may not be able to start their placement and may jeopardize their progress in the program. The fees for the police record check vary, and students can find more information on the pre-placement website. Clinical placements require students to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Domestic students can apply through Ontario Colleges, but due to limited clinical placement availability, there are a limited number of seats open to applicants lacking specific clinical experience. For details, contact nursing@georgebrown.ca or Chelsea Ovsonka at 416-415-5000, ext. 2349 or email chelsea.ovsonka@georgebrown.ca.
